author: STEVE DOERSCHUK Repository sports writer
title: Browns' game-day preview
text: Stadium TV WOIO Channel 19, Iwith an Eagle, Dan Fouts, Evan Washburn RADIO Browns Radio Network (WHBC-AM 1480, WAKR-AM 1590, WJER-AM 1450, WBTC-AM 1540, WQKT-FM 104.5, WONE-FM 97.5. WAKR-AM 850, WKRK-FM 92.3, WNCX-FM 98.5 LINE Broncos by 41⁄2. WEATHER Partly sunny, high of 46, winds to 20 mph. SERIES TREND Starting in 1991, the Broncos have won the last 10 meetings. Denver leads 19-5 overall. BRONCOS ON ROAD Won 19-13 at Kansas City on Sept. 17; won 24-12 at Detroit on Sept. 27; won 16-10 at Oakland last Sunday. BROWNS AT HOME Beat Tennessee 28-14 on Sept. 20; lost 27-20 to Oakland on Sept. 27. LAST WEEK The Broncos led just 9-7 in the fourth quarter before cornerback Chris Harris hit Derek Carr with a 74-yard pick-six. It was the third touchdown of he season produced by Denver’s defense. Manning was intercepted twice by Oakland’s Charles Woodson. Denver’s defense held four Oakland backs to 64 yards on 23 carries. Carr went 26-of-39 for 249 yards. … The Browns got a franchise-record 457 passing yards from AFC offensive player of the week Josh McCown in a 33-30 overtime win at Baltimore. SCOREBOARD The Broncos have outscored their foes, on average, 22.6-15.8; the Browns have been outscored 26.4-23.6. BROWNS ATTACKING No. 28 run offense (88.4 yards a game) vs. No. 5 run defense (85.2); No. 6 pass offense (289.0) vs. No. 5 pass defense (192.8). BRONCOS ATTACKING No. 30 run offense (71.6) vs. No. 31 run defense (149.4); No. 23 pass offense (231.0) vs. No. 18 pass defense (251.0). THE RACE In terms of budding wild-card considerations, seven AFC teams have better records than the Browns, and six are worse. If the Browns win and get to 3-3, they can pull even with Buffalo (if the Bills lose to unbeaten Cincinnati) and Pittsburgh (if the Steelers lose to 4-1 Arizona).
